website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy machine, but it's more expensive than our best of the best pick with no obvious difference in quality.
pros: Stands out for its palm-trigger design that is comfortable and easy to use
cons: It's more expensive than the Surebonder but it has less power and doesn't heat up as effectively

customer_reviews.title: 5 for just being a joy to use 1 extra for a rare quality in ...
customer_reviews.text: 6 stars! 5 for just being a joy to use 1 extra for a rare quality in the world, repairability! I had a decent gun for ~15 years that I got at a craft store. still have it but the control and the volume that this gun puts out is just amazing I do 10 times as much with it. I used to think I could fix everything now I really can!:) 3M I love their stuff Note: you can use either the quad glue sticks or the 2" / 5/8" sticks with this if you just take the quad part off. I have used it both ways. Sometimes certain glues are only available or cheaper in one format.
customer_reviews.author: serac

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feed a 3M gluestick properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glue gun to feed 3M Quadrack glue sticks. The feed mechanism only operates intermittently, failing to engage and leaving me pushing the sticks in with my left hand while holding the gun in my right. I'm looking to buy a cheap import to see if they will do better. It's tough if you want to use the 3M adhesives (good stuff), but the "correct" gun is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Aquaman

customer_reviews.title: Don't assume...
customer_reviews.text: ..that you can remove the Quadrack Converter and use it as normal. That requires bits that are missing from this kit. So you can only use it with Quadrack supplies. Otherwise it's just great. Fast heating, very good quality, easy to use. Unless you have somewhere to hang it from though, you should consider a stand as well.

customer_reviews.title: Best glue gun ever
